p: Citrus limon belongs to the Rutaceae family with yellow edible fruits and evergreen leaves. It is rich in vitamin C, and its juice is traditionally applied to treat fevers, sore throats, scurvy, chest pain, and high blood pressure (Klimek‐Szczykutowicz et al., 2020). The C. limon essential oil contains limonene (the main component of the essential oil), β‐pinene, γ‐terpinene, sabinene, linalool, myrcene, geranial, and so forth. The limonene‐loaded edible coatings have been used as antimicrobial and antioxidant agents to increase the shelf‐life different food products (Dhital et al., 2018; Maleki et al., 2018).
